column1: #Text=[_Learning Multi-View Aggregation In the Wild for Large-Scale 3D Semantic Segmentation_](https://arxiv.org/abs/2204.07548)
#Text=**If you ‚ù§Ô∏è or simply use this project, don't forget to give the repository a ‚≠ê,
#Text=  title={Learning Multi-View Aggregation In the Wild for Large-Scale 3D Semantic Segmentation},
#Text=  author={Robert, Damien and Vallet, Bruno and Landrieu, Loic},
#Text=  journal={Proceedings of the IEEE/CVF Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition},
#Text=We propose to exploit the synergy between **images** üñºÔ∏è and **3D point clouds**
#Text=‚òÅÔ∏è by learning to select the most relevant views for each point.
#Text=| üö´ No need for 3D colorization, meshing, depth sensor, synthetic views, or 2D labels |
#Text=|                 ‚úÖ Only needs **raw point clouds, images, and poses**                 |
#Text=- 2023-01-11 Fixed some bug when using intermediate fusion
#Text=- 2022-04-20 Added notebooks and scripts to get started with DeepViewAgg
#Text=- 2022-04-27 Added pretrained weights and features to help reproduce our results
#Text=The following must be installed before installing this project.
#Text=All remaining dependencies (PyTorch, PyTorch Geometric, etc.) should be installed using the provided [installation script](install.sh).
#Text=The code has been tested in the following environment:
#Text=- You will need to have **sudo rights** to install [MinkowskiEngine](https://github.com/NVIDIA/MinkowskiEngine) and [TorchSparse](https://github.com/mit-han-lab/torchsparse) dependencies.
#Text=- ‚ö†Ô∏è **Do not** install Torch-Points3D from the official repository, or with `pip`.
#Text=This work builds on and modifies a fixed version of the framework and has not been merged with the official repository yet.
#Text=In particular, this repository **introduces numerous features for multimodal learning on large-scale 3D point clouds**.
#Text=In this repository, some TP3D-specific files were removed for simplicity.
#Text=‚îú‚îÄ notebooks               # Notebooks to get started with multimodal datasets and models
#Text=‚îú‚îÄ scripts                 # Some scripts to help manage the project
#Text=    ‚îú‚îÄ datasets            # All code related to datasets
#Text=    ‚îú‚îÄ modules             # Basic modules that can be used in a modular way
#Text=‚îî‚îÄ train.py                # Main script to launch a training
#Text=Several changes were made to extend the original project to multimodal learning on point clouds with images.
#Text=The most important ones can be found in the following:
#Text=This is where the DeepViewAgg module can be found.
#Text=- `torch_points3d/visualization/multimodal_data.py`: tools for interactive visualization of multimodal data.
#Text=Notebook to create synthetic toy dataset and get familiar with 2D-3D mappings construction :
#Text=Notebooks to create dataset, get familiar with dataset configuration and produce interactive visualization.
#Text=You can also run inference from a checkpoint and visualize predictions:
#Text=Notebooks to create multimodal models, get familiar with model configuration and run forward and backward passes for debugging:
#Text=Notebooks to run full inference on multimodal datasets, from a model checkpoint.
#Text=Those should allow you to reproduce our results by using the pretrained models in [Models](#models):
